700559f-a.text:
Boynton Ave., east side, between Westchester Ave. and East 172nd Street, showing the Watson Mansion on the William Watson estate. The G.W. Bromley map of 1913 ahows the mansion no longer to be there and its site to be occupied (1927,map) by 2-story brick dwellings.
1911.
Gift of Randall Comfort.

702111f.text:
Jestchester Avenue (foreground ), north side, from Boynton Avenue (right) to Peeler Avenue, showing part 2 of a panoramic vi-w of the iatson estate. On the rioh t, in front of which foynton Avenue was Piter laid out, is the sur otuous Vatson Mansion. The estate is being leveled out for the laving of public thoroughfares and future residentiaJ development. The dirt road on the left is the former :ats mns lane, which led up past the mansion toward West Farms Road. It later became Wheeler Avenue. This is mount 2B and showa the same secticn of the estate seen on mount 2A, taken several months later.
About 19l0

700558f-a.text:
1204 to 1226 Boynton Ave. (from fore to background), at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Westchester Ave. Also shown (left) is No. 1537-1539 Westchester Ave., at the N.W. corner of Boynton Ave.
